note_models.name: Basic

fields: From a networking standpoint, what do you need to create for or with your Azure Virtual Machine
A <font color="#e11cbe">Vnet</font> and a <font color="#e11cbe">subnet</font>.
What is the first step in creating a VM in the Azure portal?
Finding a virtual machine image to use
What are 8 things you have to choose when creating an Azure Virtual Machine

* Virtual Machine Image
* A Name
* the Disk Type
* Username and Password (optionally an SSH key for a linux VM)
* The subscription
* A resource group
* The location
* The VM Size
Why use the Azure CLI or Powershell over the portal to create VMs or other Azure resources?
It will add speed and consistency to your resource creation.
What are the 3 primary tools for interacting with your Azure resources programatically?

* Azure CLI
* PowerShell
* CloudShell
What platforms is Azure CLI available on?

Windows
Mac
Linux
In WSL
In a Docker Container
On what platforms can you use PowerShell to interact with Azure resources?

* On Windows through the built in PowerShell
* On Windows, Mac, Linux and Docker Containers using the cross platform PowerShell Core.
What is CloudShell?

A shell, accessible from your browser, that you can use to manage your Azure resources.

It provides bash, PowerShell and Azure CLI.
What is <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Drive</font>?

The landing place for Azure CloudShell.

It represents your Azure resources as a file system.
Is CloudShell session state persisted?
It is not persisted.  Additionally, there is a timeout after 20 minutes of inactivity.
How do you <font color="#e11cbe">store scripts</font> and data in <font color="#e11cbe">CloudShell</font>?

Azure uses File Storage to persist data.

It's mounted as `clouddrive` in your $HOME directory, and is available in both bash and powershell.
What is the Azure CLI command to <font color="#e11cbe">create</font> a <font color="#e11cbe">resource group</font>?

az group create \
  --name "the name" \
  --location "centralus"
What is the Azure CLI command to <font color="#e11cbe">create</font> a <font color="#e11cbe">VNet</font> (with some common params)

az network vnet create \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --name "the-vnet" \
 --address-prefix "10.1.0.0/16" \
 --subnet-name "the-subnet" \
 --subnet-prefix "10.1.1.0/24"

* NOTE: Because of the last 2 parameters, this command will simultaneously create the subnet "the-subnet" along with the vnet
How do you create a public IP address in Azure CLI?

az network public-ip create \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --name "the-ip-name"
How do you create a Network Security Group in Azure CLI?

az network nsg create \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --name "the-nsg-name"
How do you create a <font color="#e11cbe">Network Interface</font> with <font color="#e11cbe">Azure CLI</font>?

az network nic create \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --name "the-nic-name" \
 --vnet-name "the-vnet" \
 --subnet "the-subnet" \
 --network-security-group "the-nsg" \
 --public-ip-address "the-ip-name"
What is the Azure CLI command to <font color="#e11cbe">create a virtual machine</font> (with some common parameters)?

az vm create \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --location "centralus" \
 --name "the-vm-name" \
 --nics "the-nic" \
 --image "rhel" \
 --admin-username "admin" \
 --authentication-type "ssh" \
 --ssh-key-value ~/.ssh/my_key_rsa.pub
How do you open port 22 on a virtual machine using Azure CLI?

az vm open-port \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --name "the-vm-name" \
 --port "22"
How do you list the ip address(es) of a VM using Azure CLI?

az vm list-ip-addresses \
  --name "the-machine-name"
In PowerShell Core, what module do you need to install to get the Azure cmdlets?

Currently:

Install-Module -Name Az -AllowClobber -Scope CurrentUser

Deprecated:

Install-Module AzureRM.Netcore
What are the 6 states for a VM?

Starting
Running
Stopping
Stopped
Deallocating
Deallocated
When a VM is stopped, are you still being  charged for it?

Yes, because it still occupies hardware in the cloud.

To avoid being charged, you have to go a step further and deallocate the VM.
What are the 2 primary ways of creating custom VM images?

* Start with a marketplace image and customize it
* Upload a VHD image from a local VM.
What are the steps involved in creating a custom VM image from a marketplace image?

* New up a VM using an image from the marketplace
* Make your customizations
* use {sysprep,waagent} to remove machine specific data/settings
* Stop and deallocate the VM
* Mark the image as Generalized
* Create a custom image
What command do you use to Generalize a Windows VM?

sysprep.exe /generalize /shutdown /oobe

This removes all computer specific information. 

/oobe stands for Out Of Box Experience.

/shutdown only shuts down the OS.  You still have to shutdown and deallocate the VM itself.
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">waagent</font> command?

* It comes from the Azure VM Agent
* It is pre-installed on Azure marketplace images
* It is available from your distro's package repositories if you are using your own images
What command do you use to <font color="#e11cbe">Deallocate</font> (aka Generalize) a <font color="#e11cbe">Linux</font> VM image?

sudo waagent -deprovision+user -force

After the command is finished, Shutdown and Deallocate the VM.
What is the AZ CLI command to deallocate a VM?

az vm deallocate \
--resource-group "the-group" \
--name "the-name"
What is the AZ CLI command to generalize a VM?

az vm generalize \
  --resource-group "the-group" \
  --name "the-name"
What is the Azure CLI command for <font color="#e11cbe">creating</font> a <font color="#e11cbe">custom vm image</font>?

az image create \
 --resource-group "the-group" \
 --name "the-name" \
 --source "the-generalized-vm-name"
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">powershell</font> command to <font color="#e11cbe">change your active subscription</font> in Azure?

Select-AzSubscription Â´
-SubscriptionName "the name"
What is the powershell command to get an Azure VM's status?

Get-AzVM `
-ResourceGroupName "the group" `
-Name "the name" `
-Status
Can you use a custom image to create an Azure VM in a different region than the image is stored in?

No, unless you copy the image to the current region using one of the two following methods:

* Acure CLI - Image Copy Extension
* Powershell - Manual process
What extension do you need to install into AZ CLI to be able to copy a VM image from one region to another? What command installs the extension?
az extension add --name <font color="#e11cbe">image-copy-extension</font>
What are the two tiers of disk storage in Azure?

Standard - magnetic media
Premium - SSD
What are the fixed constraints of Standard Storage in Azure?

Throughput - 60Mbps/sec
IOPS - 500 per disk
How does the tier of VM relate to the performance of Azure storage?

Basic tier machines cap out at 300 IOPS 
Standard tier machines cap out at 500 IOPS

when looking at 8k IOs.
What are the benefits of SSD discs in the Standard tier, since they have the same limitations as HDD in terms of Throughput and IOPS?
They are low latency, and can be a good fit for webservers or other workloads where latency matters, but the throughput and IOPS demands are low.
When used in a VM, what is the difference in how performance is determined between Standard and Premium storage disks?
Standard disks are limited by the VM, where Premium discs performance is entirely determined by the SKU of the disk itself.  It will not be limited or constrained by the VM you put it in.
How can you get better performance from premium storage disks than their specs?
You can aggregate multiple disks together using <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Space </font>on Windows or <font color="#e11cbe">Linux Volume Manager </font>on Linux to combine the Throughput and IOPS.
What are the types of Azure Disks?

Managed and Unmanaged

Standard and Premium

What is Microsoft's recommendation for <font color="#e11cbe">Standard</font>/<font color="#e11cbe">Premium</font> storage, and <font color="#e11cbe">Managed</font>/<font color="#e11cbe">Unmanaged</font> disks?

For critical production workloads, they recommend Premium and managed disks.

For non-critical production workloads and backup scenarios, they recommend standard disks.

What are the standard drive letters for Windows VMs in Azure for 

* Operating System
* Temporary Files
* Data

* C: Operating System
* D: Temporary Files
* [X]: Data

What are the standard mount points for Linux VMs in Azure for 

* Operating System
* Temporary Files
* Data

* /dev/sda - Operating System
* /dev/sdb - Temporary Files
* /dev/sd[X] - Data
What are 6 common administrative tasks you can perform on Virtual Disks in Azure?

* Create/Provision
* Attach to a VM
* Prepare the disk for an OS
* Create a Snapshot
* Resize
* Remove
How are Azure Snapshots the same and different between OS disk and Data disk snapshots?

They are identical in how they are created, but different in how they are used.

A data disk snapshot can be mounted to any VM, including the one that created it.

An OS disk snapshot had to be mounted to a new VM that doesn't already have an OS disk.
What is the AZ CLI command to create and <font color="#e11cbe">attach a virtual disc</font> to a <font color="#e11cbe">virtual machine</font>

az vm disk attach \
    --resource-group "the-group" \
    --vm-name "the-machine" \
    --name "the-disk-name" \ #Used to be --disk, but that's being deprecated
    --new \
    --size-gb 25 \
    --sku "Premium_LRS" # {StandardSSD_LRS, Standard_LRS}
What do you have to do before resizing the virtual disk that's mounted to a VM that is currently running?
You have to stop and deallocate the VM.
What is the Azure CLI command to resize a virtual disk?

az disk update \
    --resource-group "the-group" \
    --name "the-vm-name" \
    --size-gb 100
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">AZ CLI</font> command for detaching a virtual disk from a VM?

az vm disk detach \
    --resource-group "the-group" \
    --vm-name "the-vm-name" \
    --name "the-disk-name"
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">AZ CLI</font> command for deleting a virtual disk?

az disk delete \
    --resource-group "the-group" \
    --name "the-disk-name"
What Azure CLI command lets you see a list of virtual disks?
az disk list
What is the Azure CLI command for creating a virtual disk snapshot?

az snapshot create \
    --resource-group "the-group" \
    --source "the-virtual-disk-name-from-az-disk-list" \
    --name "the-name-of-the-snapshot"
What is the AZ CLI command for listing virtual disk snapshots?
az snapshot list
In AZ CLI, how can an OS virtual disk's snapshot be leveraged when creating a VM?

az vm create \
    --resource-group "the-group" \
    --name "the-vm-name" \
    --attach-os-disk "the-os-snapshot-name" \
    --os-type "Linux"
What is Azure <font color="#e11cbe">DevTest Labs</font>?

Lets you provision and create VMs, install software, manage configurations, and make them accessible to users.

Located in Azure as a subset of Azure Lab Services.
What are use cases for Azure <font color="#e11cbe">DevTest Labs</font>?

* Development - Stand up pre-configured dev machines for developers
* Test - Give testers an environment to test an app and configure it how they want.
* Training/Classroom - Stand up a collection of machines for students in a class
How does Azure DevTest Labs leverage <font color="#e11cbe">Artifacts</font>?
You can configure the deployment of artifacts to VMs in the lab, allowing you to <font color="#e11cbe">separate management</font> of the VM from the application you want to run on it.
What are <font color="#e11cbe">Formulas</font> in terms of Azure DevTest labs?
VM definitions that can be deployed to many VMs quickly.  i.e. setting up VMs for a classroom full of students.
How does Azure <font color="#e11cbe">DevTest Labs</font> balance giving developers and testers flexibility, while giving IT control?

Developers and testers can spin up environments as they need (including integration with Azure DevOps CI/CD), but IT can use <font color="#e11cbe">Policies</font> to constrain things like networking, Active Directory configuration, hours of operation, etc.
What are some (2) examples of using <font color="#e11cbe">Policies</font> to control costs in Azure DevTest Labs?

* Defining Startup and Shutdown times
* Limiting number of VMs per {class, user}
What are the 3 possible access methods for VMs in an Azure DevTest Lab?

Private
Shared
Public
Which remote access method uses the combination of a single IP and a collection of ports to expose VMs in an Azure DevTest Lab?
Shared
What Azure resource do you configure to open a network port to allow remote access to a VM?
Network Security Group
To update an existing custom VM image, what steps must you perform?

* Provision a new VM from the custom image
* Make the desired changes
* Generalize the VM
* Create a new image
What kind of Azure VM disk types require you to account for <font color="#e11cbe">scalability targets</font> when adding new disks to your Azure environment?

Unmanaged Disks

Managed disks handle this for you transparently
What are the 2 major categories of SQL hosting in Azure?

IaaS - VM w/ SQL installed
PaaS - Azure SQL Database
What are the Azure PaaS SQL offerings?

Managed Instance - per core licensing, discounts if you already have a server license

Single Database

Elastic Pool - Many databases sharing DTUs
What are the pricing models of <font color="#e11cbe">PaaS SQL</font> in Azure?

DTU - paying by the transactions or compute power
vCore - paying by the hardware
What is the least expensive pricing plan for Azure SQL PaaS?
DTU
Can you convert from DTU to vCore based pricing for SQL PaaS in Azure with no downtime?
Yes
When creating a virtual server for PaaS SQL in Azure, what does the 'Allow Azure services to access server' checkbox enable?

* Use of the Query Editor from the Azure portal
* Allowing Azure VMs, app services, etc to have access
What are some ways you can <font color="#e11cbe">allow network connectivity</font> from your machine to a SQL instance in Azure?

From the Firewall settings for the database in Azure Portal: 

* Whitelist the IP you're connecting from ('Add Client IP' button adds your current IP address)
* Use Site-to-Site or Point-to-Site connectivity
What are the 4 SQL Command Categories?

Data Manipulation Language - SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE
Data Control Language - GRANT, REVOKE
Transactional Control Language - COMMIT, ROLLBACK
Data Definition Language - CREATE, ALTER, DROP
What is the T-SQL syntax to alter a column's datatype?

ALTER TABLE [schema].[table_name]
ALTER COLUMN ColumnName VARCHAR(50)
When creating the initial admin user account for an Azure SQL PaaS database, where is that user account created?
In the <font color="#e11cbe">master</font> database.
What is a contained database user?

A user whose login is stored in the target or contained database, rather than the master database, which is the more traditional approach.

It is possible that in the future, Microsoft may require users to switch to this model in the future to attain a higher availability SLA
What role can Virtual Networks play in enabling access to Azure SQL databases?
By granting access to a virtual network in the firewall protecting your SQL server, you conveniently grant access to App Services and other resources hosted within that virtual network.
Why might you not want to allow access for an App Service to an Azure SQL database by whitelisting it's IP Addresses?

Because an App Service can use many outbound IP addresses, and you have to add a rule for each one individually.  It might be OK for a single App Service, but won't scale well if you have multiple App Services.

An easier alternative is to whitelist a VNet, and put the app service into the whitelisted VNet
What is the difference between a traditional database User principle and a Contained DB User?

A Contained DB User has it's username and password stored directly in the database it's contained in, and will travel with that database if it is ever relocated.

The traditional User is mapped to a Login that is stored in the master database.  If you relocate this database, you will have to create a Login on the new database and map it to the User.
What are the T-SQL commands for creating a <font color="#e11cbe">login</font> and associated <font color="#e11cbe">user</font>?

CREATE LOGIN theLoginName WITH PASSWORD 'superstrongsecret'

CREATE USER theUserName FOR LOGIN theLoginName
What is the T-SQL command for creating a <font color="#e11cbe">Contained DB User</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">CREATE USER</font> theUserName <font color="#e11cbe">WITH PASSWORD</font> = 'supersecretpassword'
What is the T-SQL command for creating an Active Directory user?
<font color="#e11cbe">CREATE USER</font> [user@domain.com] <font color="#e11cbe">FROM EXTERNAL PROVIDER</font>
What are some reasons for setting up <font color="#e11cbe">Auditing</font> on a SQL server?

* Regulation Compliance - health regulations, etc
* Suspicious Activity - failed logins or injection attempts
* Unusual Activity or Performance Issues - query failures or long running queries
What are 3 destinations in Azure where you could send your SQL audit logs?

* Blob Storage
* Log Analytics
* Event Hub
How can you view <font color="#e11cbe">Audit Logs</font> for sql databases from within the Azure portal?

On the <font color="#e11cbe">Audit</font> blade of your database, there is a "<font color="#e11cbe">View Audit Logs</font>" button on the top of the page that will give you an overview and allow you to drill down further.
From the Audit Records blade of an Azure Database, what is one option that will allow you to query for specific log records that might not be in the overview
Click '<font color="#e11cbe">Run in Query Editor</font>' and use the built in SQL query editor in the Portal
What recent SQL security feature might be helpful in a multi-tenant database?
Row level security
What are 3 Encryption options for Azure SQL databases?

* Transpartent Data Encryption
* Always Encrypted
* Column Encryption in T-SQL
In Azure SQL, what is Dynamic Data Masking?
A collection of functions that allow you to obscure data, such as displaying an only a few characters from an email address, rather than the entire thing.
When looking at a SQL database in the Azure Portal, what 4 blades are available in the <font color="#e11cbe">Intillegent Performance</font> section?

* Performance Overview
* Performance Recommendations
* Query Performance Insight
* Automatic Tuning
What types of recommendations will Azure SQL <font color="#e11cbe">Performance Recommendations</font> make?

* Create Index - Will auto-revert if it doesn't improve performance
* Drop Index - when there is duplication
* Parameterize Queries - Trys to better leverage the reuse of Query Execution Plans
* Fix Schema Issues - Deprecated, because it's being moved to the Intelligent Insights report
In the Azure portal, when looking at a SQL database, what information will <font color="#e11cbe">Query Performance Insight</font> give you?

* Top Resource Consuming Queries
* Top Queries by Duration
* Top Queries by Execution Count
Where can Azure SQL Diagnostics Telemetry Log data be saved?

* Azure Storage
* Log Analytics
* Event Hub
What are the 4 services in Azure offered as part of Azure Storage?

* Blob Storage
* File Storage
* Table Storage
* Queue Storage
How much data can you store in an Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Account</font>?

500TB without asking

You can ask to have the limit increased to 5 PetaBytes, or 10x more than the default limit.
How many Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Accounts</font> can you create under one <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Subscription</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">200</font>, without asking.  More if you ask Microsoft.
In Azure Storage, when using <font color="#e11cbe">Locally Redundant Storage</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">LRS</font>), How many copies of your data are stored in the selected data center?
In choosing an Azure Storage Account kind, what is the difference between StorageV2 (general purpose v2) and BlobStorage?

BlobStorage is for blobs only.

StorageV2 includes everything in BlobStorage, plus allows for File, Table and Queue storage as well.
What does Zone-redundant storage provide?

Your data will be distributed across 2 or 3 data centers in the region you chose.  

If an entire data center goes down, you will still have your data, but if an entire region goes down, you will lose it.
When using Geo-redundant storage (GRS), how is your data stored?

3 copies in a data center in your chosen region, and 3 copies in a data center in a different region.  

The data in the backup data center is only accessible in the event of a failover.
What is the difference between Read-Access Geo-Redundant Storage (RA-GRS) and GRS?

In RA-GRS, the data in the backup data center provides read-access at all times.

For normal GRS, the backup data is only available in the event of a failover.
Can Premium Storage be used for BlobStorage?
No.  Currently Premium storage can only be used for VM disks.
What is the "<font color="#e11cbe">secure transfer required</font>" setting for Azure Blob Storage?
If you enable it, only <font color="#e11cbe">HTTPS</font> requests will be able to access the stored data.
What are Azure Blob Containers?
They exist under a Storage Account, and are like root folders for storing blobs.
How many Blob Containers can you create under a <font color="#e11cbe">storage account</font>?
It is <font color="#e11cbe">unlimited</font>.
How many blobs can you store in an Azure Blob Container?
The number is unlimited, as long as the total file size for the storage account as a whole are adhered to.
What are the components to a URI for a blob in Azure Blob Storage?
http{,s}://[<font color="#e11cbe">storage-acct-name</font>].blob.core.windows.net/[<font color="#e11cbe">container-name</font>]/[<font color="#e11cbe">resource.name</font>]
Azure blob storage in a blob container is flat.  How can you organize your blobs if you have a lot?
The name can include the '/' character, making it appear as blobs were organized into a directory structure.
What are the 3 levels of access an Azure Blob Container can provide?

Private - an SAS key is required to access a blob
Blob - Anyone with a URL to a blob can access it, but you cannot browse
Container - Like Blob access, but users can also discover blobs by listing them.
What URL parameter lets you list the blobs in an Azure blob container?
http{,s}://[storage-acct-name].blob.core.windows.net/[container-name]<font color="#e11cbe">?comp=list</font>
What are the three blob types available for Azure Blobs and their purposes?

* Block Blob - have to be completely replaced, like uploading a new photo or logo.
* Append Blob - can add to the end.  Great for log files
* Page Blob - random read/write access.  Needed for VM Hard Drives.
When it comes to Azure Blob storage pricing, what is one way that <font color="#e11cbe">Hot</font> storage differs from <font color="#e11cbe">Cool</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">Archive</font>?
With Hot storage, you do not pay for <font color="#e11cbe">data retrieval</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">data writing</font>.
Which NuGet package is used for working with Azure Blob Storage?
Microsoft.Azure.Storage.Blob
What are 3 GUI clients you can use to access Azure Storage Accounts?

Azure Storage Explorer - standalone desktop app

Cloud Explorer - integrated into Visual Studio

Azurite - cross platform application
What options can you use to emulate Azure Storage on your local machine for development?

Microsoft Azure Storage Emulator - Windows Only
Azurite - open source, node.js based
How much metadata can you store on each Azure Blob? (in kilobytes)
You can use up to <font color="#e11cbe">8k</font> total across all of the key/value pairs.
What are the parameters used in the Shared Access Signature (SAS) portion of an Azure Blob URI?

* sp=rwcd -> Permissions
* st=[datetime] -> Start Time
* se=[datetime] -> End time
* spr=https -> Protocol
* sv=2017-11-09 -> Storage service version
* sig=[sha256] -> The Signature
* sr=b -> Storage resource (b for Blob)
What is the most important part of a Shared Access Signature (SAS) in terms of controlling access to Azure Blobs?
The expiry time.
What are the two types (scopes) of Shared Access Signatures in Azure?

* Service level
* Account level
What property helps you implement <font color="#e11cbe">Optimistic Concurrency</font> when handling Azure Blobs?
The <font color="#e11cbe">ETag</font>
What tool is available to implement <font color="#e11cbe">Pessimistic Concurrency</font> when working with Azure Blobs?

Leases.

You can acquire a LeaseId, which lasts for a specified period of time, and pass it as a parameter into your operations.  Anyone attempting to modify a blob or its metadata without a valid lease id will not be able to.
What operation can you perform on a Leased Azure Blob if you need to operate on it?
Break Lease
What is the relationship between an Azure Blob and its Snapshots?

* Snapshots are Read Only
* A Snapshot belongs to a base Blob, and cannot live without it.
* A Blob can have many snapshots
Using the C# Client library, what <font color="#e11cbe">CloudBlobContainer</font> method and parameter(s) would you use to delete a Blob?
.<font color="#e11cbe">DeleteAsync</font>(theBlockBlob);
What type of metadata can you store on Blob Containers and Blobs?
Key/Value pairs
When two users are updating Azure Block Blobs at the same time, what is the default behavior?
The last or final sequential update "wins".
Using the C# Client Library, what <font color="#e11cbe">CloudBlockBlob</font> method would you use to create a snapshot of an Azure Blob?
.<font color="#e11cbe">CreateSnapshotAsync</font>();
How would you find out how many blobs are stored in your Azure storage account?
Using <font color="#e11cbe">Metrics</font>, create a chart that uses the "<font color="#e11cbe">Blob Count</font>" metric
What is the maximum number of Blobs that will be returned by <font color="#e11cbe">ListBlobsSegmentedAsync</font>()?
<font color="#e11cbe">5,000</font>
When using <font color="#e11cbe">ListBlobsSegmentedAsync</font>, if you need to access more blobs than you can list at once, what do you do?
Use the <font color="#e11cbe">BlobContinuationToken</font> returned by ListBlobsSegmentedAsync to make subsequent requests until the token returns <font color="#e11cbe">null</font>.
If you needed a way of listing subsets of blobs by some attribute, what naming strategy would make this easy?

Since <font color="#e11cbe">ListBlobsSegmentedAsync</font> can use a <font color="#e11cbe">prefix</font> paremeter, name your files in a way to leverage that. I.e., if date matters, you could use a schema like <font color="#e11cbe">YYYY/MM/DD</font>/theblob.name in your naming convention.
In the .Net client libary for Blobs, what CloudBlockBlob method can be used to retrieve a Blob's metadata?
.<font color="#e11cbe">FetchAttributesAsync</font>();
In the .Net client libary for Blobs, what CloudBlockBlob method can be used to store metadata on the blob?
.<font color="#e11cbe">SetMetadataAsync</font>();
In the .Net client libary for Blobs, what CloudBlockBlob method can be used to generate a SAS token?

var policy = new SharedAccessBlobPolicy
{
    Permissions = SharedAccessBlobPermissions.Read;
    SharedAccessExpiryTime = DateTime.Now.AddHours(1);
};

cloudBlockBlob.GetSharedAccessSignature(policy);
In the .Net client libary for Blobs, what CloudBlockBlob method can be used to break a blob's lease?
.<font color="#e11cbe">BreakLeaseAsync</font>();
In the .Net client libary for Blobs, what CloudBlockBlob method can be used to create a 1 minute lease on a blob?
.<font color="#e11cbe">AquireLeaseAsync</font>(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(1));
In the .Net client libary for Blobs, what CloudBlockBlob method can be used to set the <font color="#e11cbe">Access Tier</font> on a blob?

.SetStandardBlobTierAsync(StandardBlobTier.Archive);

Enum values include Archive, Cool, Hot and Unknown
What is the default public access level on an Azure Blob Container?
private
What is the relationship between Azure Active Directlry (AAD) and Active Directory (AD)?

* AAD is not a replacment for AD
* AAD can work with AD, but does not require AD
What is <font color="#e11cbe">WS-Federation</font>?
An older protocol using a redirect flow where, as an anonymous user, you are redirected to an authenticator site that will authenticate you, and then send you back with SAML to prove your identity
What is SAMLP?
A successor to WS-Federation that gave some improvements.
What is a <font color="#e11cbe">JWT</font> token?

Simply, a JSON Web Token

They are an open, industry standard (RFC 7519) method for representing claims between two parties
What is a typical <font color="#e11cbe">OpenID authentication flow</font>?

* Anonymous user shows up at site
* They are redirected to an authenticating site where they provide credentials
* That site posts back to your site with an id_token
* Your site establishes a session for the user
What (3) authentication protocols does Azure AD support as of late 2018

* WS-Federation
* SAMLP
* OpenID Connect
Why is <font color="#e11cbe">Proof of Key Exchange</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">PKCE</font>) a recommended protocol for mobile apps?

It solve the problem that when an id_token is returned to you, it posts back to a redirect URL that might be hijacked by another app on the device registered to the same URL. 

PKCE uses a code verifier to prevent the hijacking
In Azure Active Directory registered apps, what is the difference between an <font color="#e11cbe">Object ID</font> and and <font color="#e11cbe">Application ID</font>?

* The Object ID is a unique ID for the application
* The Application ID (also sometimes called a client id) is how the application will identify itself to Azure AD
What are the 3 major domains that you work with in regards to authentication?

* Business to Employee (B2E)
* Business to Business (B2B)
* Business to Consumer (B2C)
What are some generalities around B2B authentication?

* Each business's differing policies may conflict
* Federation is used
* Users end up logging into someone else's network
What are the Factors of Multi Factor Authentication?

* Something you know (passwords)
* Something you have (phone, dongle, etc)
* Something you are (fingerprint, face, etc)
What are the 2 tiers of <font color="#e11cbe">MFA</font> available for Azure?

* Basic MFA (free for admins and Office 365 users)
* Premium
What are the 2 pricing models for Azure MFA Authentication?

* Per User
  * Flat rate/mo
  * Good for fixed number of employees
  * Can user other per-user licenses also
* Per Authentication
  * Good for extermal users
  * Per 10 authentications (rounded up)
What does certificate authentication offer over password authentication?

* Secret information is not sent over the wire
* Central revocation is easy
* Handles both identification and authentication
* Suitable for internet scale
What is the drawback of certificate authentication over password authentication?
It requires a more complex infrastructure
What 2 options do you have for application type when registering a new application in Azure AD?

* Web App/Web API
* Native App
In Azure Active Directory (AAD), when registering to use a third party as the authentication provider, who is the <font color="#e11cbe">client</font> to the third party?
Azure AD
When do new users show up in the Users section of Azure AD B2C?
After the first successful sign-in
What is a primary disadvantage of using username/password authentication with SQL server?
It adds the burden of an additional set of password policies and user accounts to manage
What standard does the Microsoft Authenticator app use?
OAUTH
What types of credentials can the <font color="#e11cbe">OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials Grant flow</font> use?

* Passwords
* Certificates
How do you send access tokens to an API?
As an <font color="#e11cbe">Authorization</font> header
What is the difference between <font color="#e11cbe">OpenID Connect</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">OAuth</font>?
OpenID Connect includes the <font color="#e11cbe">user identity</font>
What NuGet package do you need to use to work with Azure AD?
Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory
In Windows, what server-specific data does <font color="#e11cbe">sysprep.exe</font> eliminate?

* Computer Name
* Security Identifiers (SIDs)
* Local Administrator/root identity
* Device driver cache
* Event logs
Why might you want to back up a VM before generalizing it?
Generalization is <font color="#e11cbe">destructive</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">permanent</font>.  If you will ever need the VM again, the backup will be your only way of accessing the machine.
What is a key difference between a Disk snapshot vs a VM backup?

A disk snapshot is only a backup of a single disk.

A VM backup is a backup of the virtual machine plus snapshots of each disk it utilizes.
What is the Powershell command to convert an unmanaged disk into a managed disk in Azure?
ConvertTo-AzVMManagedDisk
Which Azure feature lets administrators restrict Azure deployment properties?
Azure Policy
In an Azure ARM template, what number does <font color="#e11cbe">copyIndex</font>() start at?
zero
An <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Initiative</font> is a collection of what?
Azure Policies
What are 3 common <font color="#e11cbe">Autoscale</font> options in <font color="#e11cbe">Azure VM Scale Sets</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">VMSS</font>)?

* Scheduled
* Manual
* Metric based
What kind of work loads are most appropriate for <font color="#e11cbe">low-priority</font> VMs in a <font color="#e11cbe">Scale Set</font>?
Workloads that can be interrupted
In what section of an ARM template can you utilize the <font color="#e11cbe">copy</font> attribute?
In the <font color="#e11cbe">Resources</font> section
What are Azure Web Jobs?
They are like tasks or function apps that run in the context of your website.
What are the modes an Azure Web Job can run in?

* Scheduled
* Triggered
* Continuous
How are Azure Web Jobs <font color="#e11cbe">triggered</font> from an external source?
Using a <font color="#e11cbe">webhook</font>
In the WebJobs SDK, what is the purpose of the <font color="#e11cbe">JobHost</font>?
It <font color="#e11cbe">blocks</font> the executing application and <font color="#e11cbe">sets up the triggers</font> for functions
What is an advantage of Azure Web Jobs over function apps?
They have access to the <font color="#e11cbe">application settings</font> of the app service they are hosted in.
What type of application is created by the Visual Studio <font color="#e11cbe">Web Job template</font>?
A <font color="#e11cbe">Console</font> Application
What are Web Jobs for?
They provide a mechanism for executing <font color="#e11cbe">background work</font> for a web application.
What is the benefit of associating a Web Job with a Web Application in Visual Studio?
When the Web Application is published, the Web Job will also be published.
What is Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Identities</font>?
It's a feature of <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Active Directories</font> that prevents developers from having to manage credentials or risk checking them into source control.
What is the cost of <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Managed Identities</font>?
They are <font color="#e11cbe">free</font> with your <font color="#e11cbe">Azure AD for Azure</font> subscriptions.
What is <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Service Identity</font>?
The former name for <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Identities</font> for Azure
What does an <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Resource</font> have access to by default when you enable <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Identity</font> on it?
Nothing.
What are the two types of Azure Managed Identities?

* System Assigned
* User Assigned
If a VM with a <font color="#e11cbe">System Assigned</font> Managed Identity is deleted, what does Active Directory do for you?
It cleans up the AD credentials related to that resource

In what way are Azure <font color="#e11cbe">User Assigned </font>Managed Identities different from <font color="#e11cbe">System Assigned</font> Managed Identities in terms of resources they can be assigned to?

<font color="#e11cbe">User Assigned</font> Identities can be assigned to <font color="#e11cbe">multiple resources</font>, where <font color="#e11cbe">System Assigned</font> identities will only be assigned to a <font color="#e11cbe">single resource</font>.
Does Managed Identity offer any benefit when used with Azure resources that are <font color="#e11cbe">not RBAC aware</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">Yes</font>, providing that they accept <font color="#e11cbe">Azure AD Tokens</font>.
What is Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Instance Metadata Service</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">IMDS</font>)?

It's a REST endpoint available to all IaaS VMs that can provide information such as:

* SKU
* Networking Configuration
* Upcoming Maintenance Events
At what IP address is <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Instance Metadata Service</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">IMDS</font>) available?
<font color="#e11cbe">169</font>.<font color="#e11cbe">254</font>.<font color="#e11cbe">169</font>.<font color="#e11cbe">254</font> (well known and non-routable)
When connecting to Azure via Powershell, using <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Identities</font>, what command and parameters do you use?
Connect-AzAccount -<font color="#e11cbe">MSI</font> -Subscription <subcription-id>
What are the two types of data collected by <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Monitor</font>?

* Metrics
* Logs
What are the three flavors of Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Insights</font> Monitoring?

* Application Insights
* Container Insights
* VM Insights
What are 3 visualization options for monitoring in Azure?

* Dashboards
* Log Views
* Power BI
What is the Azure PowerShell command to create a <font color="#e11cbe">Resource Group</font>?

New-AzResourceGroup `
   -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroupVM" `
   -Location "EastUS"
How does the command <font color="#e11cbe">Get-Credential</font> apply to creating an Azure VM?

$cred = Get-Credential

Copy it into a variable and pass it in to the -Credential argument of the New-AzVm command.  It prevents your password from being visible on the screen at any time.
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">PowerShell</font> command to create a new Azure <font color="#e11cbe">VM</font> (with arguments)?

New-AzVm `
    -ResourceGroupName "myResourceGroupVM" `
    -Name "myVM" `
    -Location "EastUS" `
    -VirtualNetworkName "myVnet" `
    -SubnetName "mySubnet" `
    -SecurityGroupName "myNetworkSecurityGroup" `
    -PublicIpAddressName "myPublicIpAddress" `
    -Credential $cred // $cred = Get-Credential
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">mstsc</font> command?
<font color="#e11cbe">Microsoft Terminal Services Client</font>
In <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Alerts</font>, what is the action type <font color="#e11cbe">ITSM</font> an acronym for?
<font color="#e11cbe">IT Service Management</font> such as Service Now or System Center Service Manager
In <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Alerts</font>, how many actions can you have for each <font color="#e11cbe">Action Group</font>?
Up to <font color="#e11cbe">10</font>
What 2 ways can you add <font color="#e11cbe">Application Insights</font> to an Azure app service?

* Enable in the Azure Portal (adds extension to the app service)
* Enable explicitly in application code (more control)
What are <font color="#e11cbe">Workbooks</font> (in Azure Application Insights)
Workbooks combine text,â¯Analytics queries, Azure Metrics, and parameters into rich interactive reports.
What information do you need in your app to send data to <font color="#e11cbe">Application Insights</font>?
an <font color="#e11cbe">Instrumentation Key</font>
Which property correlates UI requests to the server's service handlers in the <font color="#e11cbe">Application Insights SDK</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">operation_id</font>
How is your Azure bill for <font color="#e11cbe">Application Insights</font> calculated?
Per <font color="#e11cbe">GB</font> of data ingested above 5 GB
Which Application Insights SDK property controls the <font color="#e11cbe">display name</font> of a component in <font color="#e11cbe">Application Map</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">cloud_rolename</font>
What 8 methods are available on the Azure Application Insights API for <font color="#e11cbe">custom events</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">metrics</font>?

* TrackPageView
* TrackEvent
* GetMetric
* TrackMetric
* TrackException
* TrackRequest
* TrackTrace
* TrackDependency
The four tenants of Cloud Computing

* Resources available On Demand
* Self Service
* Massive Scalability
* Consumption based Billing
What are the <font color="#e11cbe">3 core features</font> of Azure Batch?

* Resource Management
* Process Management
* Resource and Process Monitoring
How much does it cost to use <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch</font> is free to use.  The only charge is the <font color="#e11cbe">processing</font> consumed.
What 3 kinds of resources can be added to an <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch Account</font>?

* Pools
* Applications
* Certificates
What file type can be uploaded for an Azure Batch Application?
Zip files
What 3 things can Azure Batch use <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Accounts</font> for?

* Resource files to be used by a job
* Input files to be processed by the batches
* Output files processed by the batches
In Azure Batch, a Job is a collection of?
Tasks, which are one unit of processing of the overall Job.
What are the 4 core features of Azure Batch <font color="#e11cbe">Resource Management</font>?

* Managing nodes
* Auto scaling
* Low priority nodes
* Applications
What 3 types of nodes can be utilized in Azure Batch?

* Cloud Service Worker Roles
* Virtual Machines
* Third Party Applications
As of June 2019, how much do Azure Batch VM Compute Hours cost?
Around $<font color="#e11cbe">0.18</font> per hour
What are some common third party applications that can be used by Azure Batch?
3d rendering applications, like Autodesk Maya and 3ds Max
As far as Azure Batch resources go, why are <font color="#e11cbe">VM</font>s generally preferable to <font color="#e11cbe">Cloud Service Worker Roles</font>?

* VMs are stateful IaaS as opposed to stateless PaaS
* VMs give you full control to the OS
* VMs give you permanent storage
* VMs give you full customization
What are some of the metrics that Azure Batch Autoscaling can respond to?

* CPU Percentage
* Memory usage
* # Active Tasks
* # Running Tasks
* # Pending Tasks
* # Failed Tasks
What is the significance of <font color="#e11cbe">Low Priority Nodes</font> in Azure Batch?
Costs can be reduced by using machines during idle time, at the tradeoff of having to wait longer for them to be available.
In Azure Batch, <font color="#e11cbe">Applications</font> can be owned by what 2 things?

* Pools, which means they'll be deployed to every node in the pool
* Tasks, meaning they'll only be deployed to nodes running that task
What 5 things can Azure Batch manage in regards to <font color="#e11cbe">Jobs</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">Tasks</font>?

* Scheduling
* Job Prioritization
* Retries on failure
* Maximum task duration
* Task Dependencies
In Azure Batch, what are <font color="#e11cbe">Multi-Instance Tasks</font>?
Tasks that run on <font color="#e11cbe">multiple nodes</font>, with a <font color="#e11cbe">primary</font> and one or more <font color="#e11cbe">subtasks</font>
How do Azure Batch Multi-Instance Tasks communicate with each other?

* Inter-node communication must be enabled on the pool
* They use the Message Passing Interface (MPI)
Which tools can be used to monitor Resources and Processes in Azure Batch?

* Azure Portal
* Batch Labs Monitoring (destop application)
* Application Insights
* API Metrics through REST, .NET, Az Cli, Az Powershell
What is <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch Labs</font>?
A cross platform, open source desktop application for interacting with Azure Batch.
What tools can you use to work with or integrate with Azure Batch?

* Azure Portal
* Azure Batch Labs (Desktop Application)
* .NET applications via Azure.Batch NuGet package
* AZ Cli
* Powershell (w/ AzureRM.Batch module)
What are the Azure Batch limits on <font color="#e11cbe">Accounts</font> Per <font color="#e11cbe">Region</font> Per <font color="#e11cbe">Subscription</font>?

1-3 default
50 by asking MS Support
What are the Azure Batch limits on {<font color="#e11cbe">Dedicated,Low Priority</font>} <font color="#e11cbe">Cores</font> per Batch Account?

10-100 default
Unspecified by calling MS Support
What is the limit on <font color="#e11cbe">Active Jobs</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">Job Schedules</font> per <font color="#e11cbe">Batch Account</font>?

100-300 Default
5,000 by calling MS Support
What is the limit on <font color="#e11cbe">Pools</font> per <font color="#e11cbe">Batch Account</font>?

20-100 default
2,500 by calling MS Support
What are the Azure Batch limits on <font color="#e11cbe">concurrent tasks</font> per <font color="#e11cbe">compute node</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">4</font> per core on the nodes
What are the Azure Batch limits on <font color="#e11cbe">Applications</font> per <font color="#e11cbe">Batch Account</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">20</font>
What are the Azure Batch limits on <font color="#e11cbe">Application Packages</font> per <font color="#e11cbe">application</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">40</font>
What are the Azure Batch limits on Application Package Size?
What are the Azure Batch limits on <font color="#e11cbe">Maximum Lifetime</font> for processing jobs and why?
<font color="#e11cbe">7</font> days, because it uses <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Queues</font> behind the scenes.
What are the Azure Batch limits on <font color="#e11cbe">Compute Nodes</font> in <font color="#e11cbe">Inter-Node Communication Enabled Pool</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">100</font>
What are some considerations you should make when choosing a <font color="#e11cbe">VM</font> for an <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch</font> job?

* Have an idea of the balance of CPU, IO and Memory your task requires
* Is it possible to use caching to combat high IO?
* Are there task dependencies that might leave some nodes idle waiting on others to finish?
What <font color="#e11cbe">NuGet</font> package contains the Client Library for <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">Azure</font>.<font color="#e11cbe">Batch</font>
In Azure Batch, what is the difference between the <font color="#e11cbe">Packed</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">Spread</font> options in the <font color="#e11cbe">Task Scheduling Policy</font>?

Packed will maximuze use of 1 CPU core before assigning tasks to another core.

Spread will try to keep tasks evenly distributed across cores.
In Azure Batch <font color="#e11cbe">Autoscale Formulas</font>, what <font color="#e11cbe">read/write variables</font> do you set to control the number of nodes in your pool?

$TargetDedicatedNodes
$TargetLowPriorityNodes
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">Powershell</font> command to create an Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Batch Account</font>?

New-AzBatchAccount `
  -AccountName "theName" `
  -Location "theLocation" `
  -ResourceGroupName "theResourceGroupName"

In <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Batch</font>, regarding <font color="#e11cbe">Job</font>, <font color="#e11cbe">Pool</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">Tasks</font>, which order must you create these resources in?

Pool
Job
Tasks
What <font color="#e11cbe">Runtime Stacks</font> are supported in Azure Functions as of Jan 2020?

dotnet core
Node.JS
Java
Python
Powershell Core
What are some popular <font color="#e11cbe">triggers</font> for <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font>?

Timer
Queue Message
HTTP Requests
What are <font color="#e11cbe">Bindings</font> in regards to <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font>?

Bindings allow you to <font color="#e11cbe">use other Azure Resources</font> (Queue, Cosmos DB, Blob Storage, etc) as either inputs or outputs <font color="#e11cbe">without writing boilerplate code</font>.  Instead, you configure input and output bindings for the function app.
What are 3 benefits you gain from the <font color="#e11cbe">Serverless Architecture</font> behind <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font>?

* Servers are abstracted away from you (managed, patched, etc)
* Consumption based billing
* Auto Scaling
What are the 3 <font color="#e11cbe">hosting models</font> available in Azure Functions?

* Consumption Plan
* App Service Plan
* Docker Container
What are 3 <font color="#e11cbe">development environments</font> for <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font>?

* Azure Portal
* Visual Studio (2017 or newer)
* Azure Functions Core Tools (cross platform)
In Azure Functions, what is the distinction between a <font color="#e11cbe">Function App</font> and a <font color="#e11cbe">Function</font>?

A <font color="#e11cbe">Function App</font> is a unit of deployment that is a grouping of <font color="#e11cbe">functions</font>.  It can contain one or more functions, and holds a common configuration shared by its functions.
Can you develop <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font> with Visual <font color="#e11cbe">Studio Community Edition</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">Yes</font>
What is a primary difference between <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font> <font color="#e11cbe">v1</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">v2</font>?

v1 is based on .NET Framework, and only runs on Windows

v2 is based on .NET Standard and can be cross platform
In Azure Function Apps, is it possible to have more than one binding on a single function?
Yes
What are 3 main methods of deploying <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Function Apps</font>?

* Manual Deploy through VS or VSCode
* Automated Pipeline
* Zip File via kudu
What are Azure Functions <font color="#e11cbe">Proxies</font>?
A way of <font color="#e11cbe">intercepting</font> http requests to functions and <font color="#e11cbe">redirecting</font> or <font color="#e11cbe">transforming</font> them.
What file lets you define and configure Azure Function Proxies
proxies.json
What are the levels of <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Function access</font>?

Anonymous - open
Function - requires a specific key
Easy Auth - platform level security
What are some of the advantages of hosting an <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Function App</font> in a <font color="#e11cbe">container</font>?

Allows you to host your function app somewhere other than Azure, like in an on-prem data center or in a non-Azure cloud

Allows you to leverage container hosting in Azure (Azure Container Instances or Azure Kubernetes Services)
What are some of the disadvantages of hosting <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Function Apps</font> in <font color="#e11cbe">containers</font>?

* No Consumption Based billing
* You won't take advantage of Function Apps' auto-scaling
* No bindings to connect to other Azure Resources, like Storage Accounts or Application Insights
Using <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Function Core Tools</font>, how do you <font color="#e11cbe">initialize</font> a Function App meant to deploy via <font color="#e11cbe">Docker</font>?

func init --docker

This will create a Dockerfile along with the rest of the boilerplate for the function app
Where do you find <font color="#e11cbe">run history</font> of <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Functions</font> in the Azure Portal?
In the function app view, expand the <font color="#e11cbe">Function</font>, and click the <font color="#e11cbe">Monitor</font> node for that function.
For an Azure Function, which <font color="#e11cbe">file</font> stores information about <font color="#e11cbe">triggers</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">bindings</font>?
<font color="#e11cbe">function</font>.json
Which <font color="#e11cbe">Azure API</font> enables you to deploy an Azure Function App as an uploaded <font color="#e11cbe">Zip</font> file?
<font color="#e11cbe">Kudu</font> API
For an <font color="#e11cbe">HTTP</font> triggered <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Function App</font> named <font color="#e11cbe">Foo</font>, what will the default route be?
<font color="#e11cbe">/api</font>/Foo
What is the powershell command to create a new <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Key Vault</font>?

New-AzKeyVault `
  -VaultName 'theName' `
  -ResourceGroupName 'theGroupName' `
  -Location 'East US'

How would you modify the Azure Key Vault secret url below to get the latest version of a secret rather than a specific version?

https://myvault.vault.azure.net:443/secrets/SecretName/48c6cb3250f9481aa96142d14c608e74

Remove the key ID and refer to the secret by name only.

https://myvault.vault.azure.net:443/secrets/SecretName/48c6cb3250f9481aa96142d14c608e74
What are 2 properties you can use to protect Azure Key Vaults from being deleted?

* EnableSoftDelete
* DoNotPurge
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">AZ CLI</font> command to create a <font color="#e11cbe">managed identity</font> for a web application?

az webapp identity assign \
  --resource-group TheGroup \
  --name TheWebAppName
What is the <font color="#e11cbe">AZ CLI</font> command to create a SQL user from a <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Identity</font>?

az sql server ad-admin create \
  --resource-group TheGroup \
  --server-name TheSqlServerName \
  --display-name UserName \
  --object-id [Managed Id GUID]
If using a <font color="#e11cbe">Managed Identity</font> to connect to SQL, what resources are available to test your code on your local dev environment?

For versions of Visual Studio prior to 2017 update 5, you can install the Azure Services Authentication Extension.

VS 2017 update 5 and later have this functionality built in.
What does <font color="#e11cbe">Microsoft Credential Scanner</font> do?
It is a build task that monitors identifies credential leaks in source code, such as passwords checked into config files.
How do you configure which account to use for authentication for Azure Services in Visual Studio?
Tools > Options > Azure Service Authentication
What is the difference between <font color="#e11cbe">Data in Transit</font> and <font color="#e11cbe">Data at Rest</font>?

Data in Transit describes data that is moving across the internet, through a service bus, over the network, etc, between two endpoints.

Data at Rest is inert data that is stored physically somewhere.
What Azure Services can utilize Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Service Encryption</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">SSE</font>)?

* Azure Blob
* Azure Table
* Azure Files
* Azure Queue
* Azure Managed Disks
Is Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Service Encryption</font> optional?
<font color="#e11cbe">No</font>.  It is enabled by default and cannot be disabled.
What <font color="#e11cbe">cipher</font> is used for encryption on the <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Storage</font> platform?
256 bit AES.
Why might you want to use a <font color="#e11cbe">customer owned</font> encryption key over a Microsoft managed key for Azure <font color="#e11cbe">Storage Service Encryption</font>?

* To achieve external compliance
* For auditing keys
* For flexibility in rotating keys
* For controlling access to the keys
What <font color="#e11cbe">PowerShell</font> command let's you see if you have the <font color="#e11cbe">AzureAD</font> module installed?
Get-Module AzureAD -ListAvailable
Does Azure SQL "<font color="#e11cbe">Always Encrypted</font>" encryption cover data <font color="#e11cbe">in transit</font> or <font color="#e11cbe">at rest</font>?
Both
Who can view Azure SQL data that's been encrypted with the <font color="#e11cbe">Always Encrypted</font> option?
<font color="#e11cbe">Users</font> or <font color="#e11cbe">Applications</font> who have been <font color="#e11cbe">granted access</font> to the encryption key
What is a <font color="#e11cbe">Column Master Key</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">CMK</font>)?

The CMK is used to encrypt Column Encryption Keys (CEK) which are the actual keys used to encrypt and decrypt Always On encrypted data.

Stored in key vault (always?)
For Azure SQL Databases, what are the two <font color="#e11cbe">Column Encryption Types</font>?

* Randomized
* Deterministic
What are the advantages and disadvantages of <font color="#e11cbe">Randomized</font> vs <font color="#e11cbe">Deterministic</font> column encryption?

* Randomized generates different encrypted values for the same plain text, which makes it more secure, but not searchable, joinable, indexable or groupable
* Deterministic always generates the same encrypted value, which is less secure but does allow the encrypted data to be searchable, joinable, indexable and groupable
What product do you search for in the Azure Portal to purchase an SSL certificate?
App Service Certificate
What 2 pricing tiers are available in Azure for App Service Certificates?

* S1 Standard - for a single certificate
* W1 Wild Card - a wild card certificate to cover many subdomains
What <font color="#e11cbe">PowerShell</font> command can be used to <font color="#e11cbe">add hostnames</font> to an Azure WebApp

Set-AzWebApp `
  -Name "webAppName" `
  -ResourceGroupName "theGroupName" `
  -HostNames @("name1", "name2", ...)
What <font color="#e11cbe">PowerShell</font> command can <font color="#e11cbe">assign/bind</font> a local <font color="#e11cbe">SSL certificate</font> to your Azure WebApp?

New-AzWebAppSSLBinding `
  -WebAppName "theName" `
  -ResourceGroupName "theGroup" `
  -Name "theCertName" `
  -CertificateFilePath <filesystem.path> `
  -CertificatePassword "$ecret" `
  -SslState SniEnabled
What are <font color="#e11cbe">TEE</font>s?
Trusted Execution Environments
Regarding <font color="#e11cbe">Trusted Execution Environments</font> (TEEs), what is an <font color="#e11cbe">Enclave</font>?

A grouping of code and data inside of the TEE, most likely related to a single application.

A TEE can contain many Enclaves.
What is an <font color="#e11cbe">Enclave SDK</font>?
An common <font color="#e11cbe">API</font> that runs across Trusted Execution Environments (TEEs) so that confidential applications can be <font color="#e11cbe">portable</font>.
Regarding <font color="#e11cbe">Trusted Execution Environments</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">TEE</font>s), what is <font color="#e11cbe">Attestation</font>?
The act of <font color="#e11cbe">verifying</font> code running  in <font color="#e11cbe">TEE</font>s before allowing it access to protected data.
What are the 2 major types of <font color="#e11cbe">Trusted Execution Environments</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">TEE</font>s)?

* Hardware backed
* Software backed
What technology do Azure hardware backed TEEs run on (as of 2019)?
Intel <font color="#e11cbe">Software Guard Extensions</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">SGX</font>)
What benefit does <font color="#e11cbe">Always Encrypted with Secure Enclaves</font>, introduced in <font color="#e11cbe">SQL Server 2019</font> (using software backed enclaves), offer?

Rather than send encryped data to the client to be processed, which prevented joining, grouping, sorting and filtering by randomly encrypted columns, the data is decrypted first on the server in a secure enclave, allowing queries to operate on all columns, and only the resulting data is sent to the client.
Is Always Encrypted with Secure Enclaves supported by hardware backed enclaves?
As of mid 2019, no, but Microsoft plans to use hardware backed enclaves in the future.
If you want to use your <font color="#e11cbe">own</font> encryption keys, which Azure <font color="#e11cbe">VM Disk encryption</font> product must you use?
<font color="#e11cbe">Azure Disk Encryption</font>
When using <font color="#e11cbe">Always Encrypted</font> with Azure SQL, where does the data encryption happen?
In the client appliciation
Where is the <font color="#e11cbe">Column Master Key</font> (<font color="#e11cbe">CMK</font>) for Azure's Always Encrypted option stored?
Either <font color="#e11cbe">Azure Key Vault</font> or <font color="#e11cbe">Windows Certificate Store</font>
